name: Laura Ruotsalainen
content: Laura Ruotsalainen - University of Helsinki View Scopus Profile Laura Ruotsalainen Professor, Department of Computer ScienceSupervisor for doctoral programme, Doc­toral Pro­gramme in In­ter­dis­cip­lin­ary En­vir­on­mental Sci­encesSupervisor for doctoral programme, Doctoral Programme in Computer Science﻿﻿﻿Helsinki Institute of Urban and Regional Studies (Urbaria)Helsinki Institute of Sustainability Science (HELSUS) https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4057-4143 Phone+358505560761, +358294151266Emaillaura.ruotsalainenhelsinkifi PL 68 (Pietari Kalmin katu 5)00014FinlandViikinkaari 1, Biocentre 300790 HelsinkiFinland 20122025 Research activity per year Personal profile Curriculum vitaeLaura Ruotsalainen is a Professor of Spatiotemporal Data Analysis for Sustainability Science at the Department of Computer Science at the University of Helsinki, Finland. She leads a research group in spatiotemporal data analysis for sustainability science (SDA) which performs research on estimation, Machine Learning and Computer Vision methods using spatiotemporal data for sustainable smart cities especially via smart mobility. She is a member of the steering group of the Finnish Center for AI (FCAI) and leads a FCAI Highlight area called AI for Sustainability. She is also a professor at the Helsinki Institute of sustainability Science (HELSUS), which is a cross-faculty research unit in sustainability science within the University of Helsinki. Fields of Science113 Computer and information sciencesEstimation algorithmsMachine LearningNavigation algorithmsError modellingSensor fusionspatio-temporal analysisSmart cities Collaborations and top research areas from the last five years Recent external collaboration on country/territory level.
